docs.lead_paragraph: GENTLEMEN:--I read with great satisfaction in the national Inteiligencer of this morning an interesting correspondence relative to the WEBSTER Annuity. There was no subject on which this eminently great and good man was more sensitive; and with your permission, I propose to add one incident illustrative of the refinement of feeling which characterized him.

docs.lead_paragraph: Little, business was done in the Senate yesterday, for lack of a quorum. The bill was passed for the relief of THOMAL B. PARSONS, who saved the lives of seven persons at the expense of his own health, in the year 1808.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Saturday morning the Police of the middle district, Baltimore, arrested, on various charges of rowdyism, riot, , a very large number of belligerent characters, seven or when, for want of better accommodation, were locked up in one of the first story rooms of the Station-house, an apartment provided by the city for the safe keeping of sach characters.

headline.main: WASHINGTON.; Cabinet Speculations--Democratic Harmony General News. The Commissioner of Customs--The Supreme Court Judgeship--General Pierce on Territorial Acquisition--The Sandwich Islands--Cabinet Prognostications--State of Mr. King's Health.

docs.lead_paragraph: The conflicting nature of the various " reliable" predictions relative to the Cabinet of General PPIERCE, is the best evidence that they are nothing more than the expressions of personal preference by the prophets themselves, or the vague speculations of curious busy-bodies. It is quite certain that Mr. PIERCE has given no indication of what is lo be his policy in. this respect.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Troy Whig copies form the Express a statement of the recent proceedings in the Common Council, upon the presentation of the afterpiece to the Irving House bill for boarding KOSSUTH and his companions: and appends the following.

docs.lead_paragraph: The contract for the edifice of the "Christian University" has been concluded with Mr. Solomen Jelaris, of St. Louis, at the Sum of $24,900. The building will be sufficiently large to accommodate from three to five hundred students, and will be located at Canton, on the Mississipi river--a point proverbial for its unprecedented health. Owned and controlled by the Christian Church.

docs.lead_paragraph: There was no excitement. The dancing proceeded as before, the dancers being undisturbed. Lalage and Lesbhia had faded "into air, into thin air." Pantagruel and Gargantua Were still-partially visible, but were dissipating like mist. Maria de Gloria remained by my side, and seemed to partake of my astonishment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Philosophers, milliners, and medical men have given much attention to the dress of women; but the little philosophers know about the operations of the human mind, does not qualify them to give an opinion upon dress; and as dress makers have not given themselves the trouble to study the form of the object given them to fit, medical men are alone competent to understand and to decide upon this matter.
